title: Peppa Pig World: PM asked if OK after bizarre speech quoting character
description: Boris Johnson is questioned by a reporter after talking about Peppa Pig World at a business conference.

title: Sir David Amess death: Crowds line streets in tribute
description: A funeral service is held for the Southend West MP, who was stabbed to death in October.

title: Migrant crossings: Number reaching UK this year three times 2020's total
description: More than 25,000 people have reached the UK by boat this year, including nearly 900 on Saturday.

title: Energy firm Bulb set to go into administration
description: The energy firm, with 1.7 million customers, is the largest gas and electricity company to face difficulties.

title: Manchester United: Ole sacking 'like a break-up' for fans
description: From historic last-minute goals to how nice he is to fans, Newsbeat hears about Ole's legacy.

title: WTA remain concerned for China's Peng after IOC call
description: Peng Shuai disappeared from the public eye after making sex assault allegations against a Chinese official.

title: Do more to end North-South divide, CBI tells government
description: The business group says emerging industries such as biotech should be based in the North.

title: Gareth Southgate: England manager signs new contract through to December 2024
description: England manager Gareth Southgate signs a new contract to keep him in the role until December 2024.

title: Holidaymakers urged to use £132m in travel vouchers
description: Regulator says travellers must spend credit notes issued during the pandemic or risk losing them.

title: Covid death doctor Irfan Halim touched lives, brother says
description: Surgeon Dr Irfan Halim switched to working on the frontline when the pandemic hit.

title: Wisconsin: Five dead after car ploughs into Waukesha Christmas parade
description: A speeding SUV ploughed into a Christmas celebration in Waukesha, hitting dozens including children.

title: War photographer: 'Telling people's stories gives me hope'
description: Claire Thomas says she couldn't help people in Iraq and Afghanistan, but she could tell their stories.

title: Cavendish suffers broken ribs and collapsed lung in Ghent crash
description: Mark Cavendish suffers two broken ribs and a collapsed lung in a crash at the Six Days of Ghent on Sunday.

title: Mauricio Pochettino open to leaving Paris St-Germain if Man Utd make approach
description: Paris St-Germain manager Mauricio Pochettino is not fully happy at the club and is open to any approach from Manchester United.

title: New mothers who died of herpes could have been infected by one surgeon
description: Two mothers who died of herpes after ​having Caesareans could have been infected by a single surgeon, the BBC has found.

title: Harry Potter films at 20: What the cast did next
description: As the stars prepare to reunite 20 years after the first film we look at what they've been up to.

title: Sir David Amess death: 'Several cabinet colleagues broke down'
description: Boris Johnson reveals several ministers wept as news broke of the Southend West MP's fatal stabbing.

title: Winners and losers from England's autumn Test series
description: Whose stock is up and whose is down after Test victories over Tonga, Australia and South Africa?

title: The Papers: 'Rage across Europe', and Tory social care warnings
description: The riots taking place cross several European countries feature on many of Monday's front pages.

title: Children in care in England could hit almost 100,000 by 2025
description: The figure for England would represent a 36% rise in a decade, research for county councils says.

title: Matt Doran: Australian TV host sorry for bungle that sank Adele interview
description: Matt Doran admitted during an interview with Adele that he had not listened to her new album.

title: Covid: Austria back in lockdown despite protests
description: Unrest has spread across the continent as countries bring in measures to curb infections.

title: Wet Leg: The band with millions of streams and just two songs
description: The Isle of Wight indie duo say it's surreal to see how much faith fans are putting in them.

title: The UK migrant dilemma - it's all about Brexit
description: Why is the UK government currently focusing on migrants - and what are the options for ministers?

title: London Knights: The UK’s only competitive gay men's basketball team
description: Formed in 2000, the team has won championships around the world.

title: The art of a great urban wildlife photo
description: Andrew Budziak spends his nights photographing the animals of Toronto, Canada.

title: The 99-year-old cyclist who has won a world silver medal
description: How a former World War Two pilot came second in a cycling competition for older people.

title: Kunsthaus Zurich: Looted art claims pose questions for Swiss museum
description: Emil Bührle's impressionist art collection raises problems for Zurich's big, extended Kunsthaus.

title: Stand by her: Teaching men how to be allies for women
description: Workshops to help men understand sexual harassment and abuse against women have started in Nottingham.
